channel.title: ::jail?
channel.description: Hi, can someone please give me the code for ::jail (playername) I use an Allstar 317 Source. Thanks.

item.title: ::jail?
item.dc:creator: @deadlyhorror deadlyhorror
item.description:
@deadlyhorror wrote:

[quote=“GodexCAB, post:5, topic:515965”][quote author=deadlyhorror link=topic=634220.msg4282642#msg4282642 date=1365911474]

[code]if (command.startsWith(“jail”) && playerRights > 1) {
try {
String otherPName = command.substring(5);
int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                    client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];
                    p.toX = 2933;
		p.toY = 3285;
		p.action = 1;
                    p.sM(
                            "You have been jailed naughty boy by " + playerName);
		sM("You have jailed "+p.playerName+".");
                } else { 
                   sM("The name doesnt exist."); 
                }
            } catch (Exception e) { 
                sM("Try entering a name you want to jail..");
            }

}[/code]

^ came from an allstar source
[/quote]

Thanks![/quote]

Very welcome and I respect you Jmood

Read full topic

item.title: ::jail?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

A great suggestion would be to use an IDE and read up on Java, you will learn far more then asking for people to give you code. The IDE will both help you in fixing errors, but also allow you to learn why the error was throw which is great to know, you will sooner or later be able to spot compilation errors in other peoples work which is great because now you’re helping them! Orcale the current handlers of Java have all the documentation and tutorials one would need to learn Java, so as a suggestion I suggest you look at some of it, it will help you greatly!

Read full topic
